text:
Their on-screen romance was short-lived, but despite Lachie McAleer and Clare Tamas calling it quits about six months ago there might still be some bad blood between them.
As Lachie returns to reality TV having replaced Scott Mitchell on the upcoming series of Farmer Wants A Wife, the 37-year-old said he and his Married At First Sight 'wife' no longer talk.
Chatting with OK! magazine on Thursday, the controversial star also took a sly dig at his ex, saying she had 'inundated' Scott with messages following his exclusion from the dating show.
Scroll down for video
'No, definitely not': Farmer Wants A Wife star Lachie McAleer said on Thursday he has cut ALL ties with his Married At First Sight 'wife' Clare Tamas
When Lachie was asked if he and Clare were still in touch, he answered emphatically: 'No, definitely not.'
The countryman from rural New South Wales also made claims that Clare had sent a barrage of calls and messages to ditched farmer Scott.
He told the publication he believes that Clare was at one stage calling him and that they got together.
Indeed, in an interview News.com.au conducted with Scott in July last year, the sheep farmer supported these claims, saying he had been contacted by Clare.
Bad blood? The 37-year-old also took a sly dig at his ex, saying that she plagued Scott Mitchell (pictured) who was replaced by Lachie in the upcoming series of Farmer Wants A Wife
Controversial: Lachie was added to the dating show's cast rather last minute
But it was not in a romantic sense, as Scott said she made contact to share her heartbreak and humiliating experience on MAFS and to warn him about the dangers of looking for love on camera.
'[Clare] wrote me probably 20 messages, she sent me her phone number and she said if I wanted to chat I could, so we chatted for about two hours,' he said.
'I found it funny that Lachlan was the one that got on the show and his ex-wife is contacting me,' he added.
Calling it quits: Scott alleges Clare called to lash out at her 'ex husband' and to warn him about the dangers of trying to find love on camera
'He turned it on when the cameras where on us': Clare made scathing claims Lachie was only interested in MAFS for stardom
Lachie and Clare split shortly after Married At First Sight wrapped in June 2015, with Clare having delivered a scathing account of the pair's relationship in an interview with New Idea.
'He turned it on when the cameras were on us, then was either cold or rude or distant', his flame-haired ex insisted.
'He told me that I was his dream girl and he'd never had a connection like that before, and yet quickly departed after the last cameras, with no word,' she said.
Clare has been contacted for comment.
